fold event opens a time-limited mint window; one mint per address per fold.      The contract integrates with RecursiveStrategy to trigger token burns, and each      burn event creates a new \"fold\" - a time-limited window during which users can mint. The request will automatically expire in 48 hours (172800 seconds) by default."},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Equivalent to `safeTransferFrom(from, to, id, \"\")`."},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Transfers token `id` from `from` to `to`. Requirements: - Token `id` must exist. - `from` must be the owner of the token. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - The caller must be the owner of the token, or be approved to manage the token. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement   {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon a safe transfer. returns._0: The active fold ID, or 0 if no mint window is currently active

approve(address,uint256).details: Sets `account` as the approved account to manage token `id`. Requirements: - Token `id` must exist. - The caller must be the owner of the token,   or an approved operator for the token owner. Emits an {Approval} event.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the number of tokens owned by `owner`. Requirements: - `owner` must not be the zero address.

canCreateFold().details: Returns true only if: no active window, strategy balance >= minEthForFold, and TWAP delay met

returns._0: True if createFold() would succeed, false otherwise

cancelOwnershipHandover().details: Cancels the two-step ownership handover to the caller, if any.

completeOwnershipHandover(address).details: Allows the owner to complete the two-step ownership handover to `pendingOwner`. Reverts if there is no existing ownership handover requested by `pendingOwner`.

createFold().details: Anyone can call this; will revert if a mint window is active, strategy balance is insufficient, or strategy burn fails.      Note: mint() will automatically create a fold if needed, so this function is optional.

getApproved(uint256).details: Returns the account approved to manage token `id`. Requirements: - Token `id` must exist.

getFold(uint256).details: Returns an empty struct if the fold ID doesn't exist

returns._0: The Fold struct containing startTime, endTime, and blockHash
The fold ID during which this token was minted

getSeed(uint256).details: Seed is computed on-demand from the fold's blockHash and tokenId

returns._0: The deterministic seed used for this token's generative art

isApprovedForAll(address,address).details: Returns whether `operator` is approved to manage the tokens of `owner`.

returns._0: True if a mint window is currently open, false otherwise

mint().details: One mint per address per fold; requires payment >= mintPrice (excess refunded).      If no window is active but one can be created, automatically creates a new fold.

owner().details: Returns the owner of the contract.

ownerOf(uint256).details: Returns the owner of token `id`. Requirements: - Token `id` must exist.

ownershipHandoverExpiresAt(address).details: Returns the expiry timestamp for the two-step ownership handover to `pendingOwner`.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the owner to renounce their ownership.

requestOwnershipHandover().details: Request a two-step ownership handover to the caller. The request will automatically expire in 48 hours (172800 seconds) by default.

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Transfers token `id` from `from` to `to`. Requirements: - Token `id` must exist. - `from` must be the owner of the token. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - The caller must be the owner of the token, or be approved to manage the token. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement   {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon a safe transfer. Emits a {Transfer} event.

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).details: Sets whether `operator` is approved to manage the tokens of the caller. Emits an {ApprovalForAll} event.

params._minEthForFold: New minimum ETH amount in wei

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165 This function call must use less than 30000 gas.

returns._0: Seconds until the window closes, or 0 if no window is active

tokenURI(uint256).details: Reverts if the token does not exist or if renderer is not set

params.tokenId: The token to get metadata for

returns._0: A data URI containing base64-encoded JSON metadata

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfers token `id` from `from` to `to`. Requirements: - Token `id` must exist. - `from` must be the owner of the token. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - The caller must be the owner of the token, or be approved to manage the token. Emits a {Transfer} event.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the owner to transfer the ownership to `newOwner`.

activeFoldId().notice: Get the current active fold ID

canCreateFold().notice: Check if a fold can be created

createFold().notice: Creates a new fold by triggering a burn on the strategy

currentFoldId().notice: Current fold ID (starts at 0, incremented on each fold)

folds(uint256).notice: Mapping of fold ID to fold data

getFoldId(uint256).notice: Get the fold ID for a token

getSeed(uint256).notice: Get the seed for a token

hasMintedFold(uint256,address).notice: Tracks which addresses have minted for each fold

isWindowActive().notice: Check if there is currently an active mint window

minEthForFold().notice: Minimum ETH balance required in strategy contract to create a fold

mint().notice: Mint a token for the current active fold

mintPrice().notice: Price in wei to mint one token

setMinEthForFold(uint256).notice: Update the minimum ETH balance required to create a fold

timeUntilWindowCloses().notice: Get the time remaining in the current mint window

tokenData(uint256).notice: Mapping of token ID to token data

tokenURI(uint256).notice: Returns the token URI by delegating to the renderer

windowDuration().notice: Duration of each mint window (read from strategy at deployment)
